title: Can you stop releasing voice effects on spells if we can't mute it?
body:
you see i like to hear janna talking, but i don't like yasuo spaming hasagi and camille talking **** about behavior and butchers, or SG rumble. Which is why i don't mute every voices at the same time

can we just get an in-game board where we mute champs we don't want to listen?

thanks

-gH

{{champion:99}} HAHAHAHAHAHAHAHAHA
{{champion:427}}
I remember the times of Boom Headshot uproar

You have options you know. Mute voices is one. You can mute the entire game if you need to.

Audio options exist. You don't need to complain about "I don't have enough audio options, and I need to mute a champion's spell voice and their mastery symbol and their taunts and ........"
You can't just sit there and say you need to have individual audio options for every little thing in the game. Next thing you know, people will say "I NEED <insert champion here>'s Q TO BE LOUD AND THEIR E TO BE QUIET AND OMG RITO WHY DON'T YOU HAVE OPTIONS"

> [{quoted}](name=doiminat0r3600,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=u5N3qAMK,comment-id=0001,timestamp=2017-04-13T15:33:47.721+0000)
>
> You have options you know. Mute voices is one. You can mute the entire game if you need to.
> 


but that's the thing, i want to choose who i mute and who i don't mute
if we don't have this then stop releasing voice on spells 

we didn't have this in 2012, or it was minor like nocturne ult. Now every single champs are talking and it tilts me on the face of earth when it's champion like camille or yasuo
Then ask for the talking to be dialed down. Not a muting of champions

> [{quoted}](name=doiminat0r3600,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=u5N3qAMK,comment-id=000100000001,timestamp=2017-04-13T18:30:15.537+0000)
>
> Then ask for the talking to be dialed down. Not a muting of champions

You weren't able to gather that as a solution from OP's post? He didn't need to mention that for it to be an obvious solution.

If it's so obvious, then why don't you do it yourself? If you think it's so obvious, these posts don't need to be made because **you can mute champion quotes**. If someone in your game says a lot, mute the champion voices.

> [{quoted}](name=doiminat0r3600,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=u5N3qAMK,comment-id=00010000000100000000,timestamp=2017-04-14T21:39:44.884+0000)
>
> If it's so obvious, then why don't you do it yourself? If you think it's so obvious, these posts don't need to be made because **you can mute champion quotes**. If someone in your game says a lot, mute the champion voices.

Cool dude, lets play in silence because Riot has 4 champs with shit V/Os. You're a genius.

The point is, you don't have to sit in silence. You can mute just their voices. You don't have to mute all of it.

You can even move your camera away from them. Their voice goes out of range when you don't see them on the map.

> [{quoted}](name=doiminat0r3600,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=u5N3qAMK,comment-id=0001000000010000000000000000,timestamp=2017-04-16T19:55:37.258+0000)
>
> The point is, you don't have to sit in silence. You can mute just their voices. You don't have to mute all of it.
> 
> You can even move your camera away from them. Their voice goes out of range when you don't see them on the map.

K, I'll move my camera away from my opponent everytime their V/O plays, regardless if I'm laning against them. You've got great ideas.
